key_points: Four people died amid chaos as Trump supporters stormed the US Capitol, including a woman shot by police.
The rioters breached security to halt the ceremonial counting of electoral votes confirming Biden's win.
Vice President Mike Pence, who was presiding over the vote count, was evacuated from the Capitol.
DC Police Chief confirmed three deaths were due to medical emergencies during the riot.
Multiple officers were injured, with at least one hospitalized.
At least 52 people were arrested in connection with the riot.
The National Guard and other federal forces were mobilized to secure the Capitol.
Lawmakers resumed the electoral vote count late Wednesday evening, eventually confirming Biden's win.
President Trump told rioters to go home, expressing sympathy and repeating false claims about the election.
Law enforcement safely detonated two pipe bombs found at the RNC and in the Capitol complex.
